content.description:
A hand-crack start in a left-facing corner leads to a flared tight chimney with a fist crack in the back, which comprises the bulk of the climb.

This climb is listed as "Variamte" in Bloom 2, but the plaque says "Variante Argentina".

If you climb

F.I.S.T.

, you could set a TR on this route by reaching to the right while rapping off.
content.protection:
Hand size cams for the start, fist-size cams for most of the climb.

2-bolt anchor with chains.
content.location:
On the far right side of Public Service Wall, and probably most easily reached by going around the prow from the Fin about 100 yds.  This crack is located 10' right of the obvious splitter fist crack

Federation of Interstate Truckers.

content.description: Huge right facing corner hands/thin hands/ fingers
content.location: Just right of out on a whim

content.description: Put up in about 1997. Hand jam at the roof.
content.location: On Public Service to the left of Juvenile Delinquent.

content.description:
This climb is located about 30 ft right of light duty 5.9 .

Thin hands to a good stance allows you to to take a minute think about how to best finish the route. Insecure face moves and flared hand jams lead to the anchor. Fun route that is good to do if you are in the area,

Unknown rating, so grade may be subjective (plaque was unreadable). This climb is located about 15 ft right of light duty -5.9. Start in tight finger crack that quickly turns in  to 0.5 camalots and stays that size to the anchors. Good route to practice finger stacks if you have smaller hands because face features help upward progress. Fun route!

The first 10’ climb through a relatively clean choss band (belayer beware) and immediately turns a roof with fingers. Climb the right facing corner from tips to baggy fingers.

There is no offwidth on this route despite the Kelly guidebook description.
content.protection: .3 - .75, mostly .4 and .5. Some hand size pieces protect the roof at the beginning. The anchor situation is weird.
content.location: Left side of Public Service, just left of Out on a Whim. Look for the plaque.

content.description: splitter fingers ring locks thin hand  hands fist to one move of OW ... A must do
content.location: 100 yd around the Fin

content.description: Starts with some hollow climbing on opposing flakes. After clipping the first bolt, engage in some very strange oppositional climbing, placing optional tiny gear with runners in the left crack before reaching two more generously-spaced bolts. These protect the crux climbing, with one particularly perplexing move at the 3rd bolt. After that, mellower 5.11 fingers leads to the anchor.
content.protection: Bet on using either two ropes or an 80m. Some hand sized gear to the first bolt, then a few tiny pieces, slings, draws, and some fingers pieces for the end.
content.location: Immediately left of the Diet Coke route

content.description: baggy fingers and tight hands through roof/bulge leads into an OW then squeeze to the anchors
content.location: Just left of F.I.S.T in a scary looking corridor

content.description: long right facing corner
content.location: far left side of public service wall

content.description: Short right-facing corner going from .5 to tips, mostly on .4s and .3s.
content.protection: .5 to .2, mostly .4s and .3s, one #2 or #3 for the pod

content.description: OW from fists and gets wider as you go up.
content.location: To the left of Juvenile Delinquent, on the far left side of the Public Service Wall.

content.description: Boulder moves that can not be protected off the ground brings you to a block at the start of the climb that sounds and looks loose that you must climb on to get your first piece of gear, a blue TCU, and then some crisp splitter climbing will see you to the bomber fixe rings under the huge roof.
content.protection: .5-1.5 inch an a #2 camlot for a pod half way up
content.location: top of the new trail on the left 60 yd of the hand splitter warm up.

content.description:
A worthy pitch with small gear and an OW slot at the top.

Lieback a thin start in an offset dihedral (blue metolius and blue alien) working the feet. Tough moves for a body length to gain the flared pod and some good gear. Hard for the body length after the pod then a hard mantle to establish at the base of the flared OW. Now all you have to do is climb a 20 - 25' OW to get to the chains.

Anyone trying to onsight should be able to hold on a long time as the gear is small and the rock is the softer, white sandstone. Also the crack is varied and you'll be liebacking so you need to take care placing gear as tight as possible.
content.protection: Black, blue, green aliens (though blue metolius fits better than green alien in spots), a #1 &/or #3 for the first pod. #2/#3 at the start of the OW then #4 or #5 camalot later (the OW tapers in the back).
content.location: Just right of Go Drown in a Lake of Diet Coke. Obvious tips crack with flared pods.

content.description: fingers to ring locks an some face with a bolt an a roof.
content.location: far left

content.description:
Crack system up Huge right facing corner. Its one of the larger more obvious dihedrals on the left side of the wall. Belay platform behind a large pillar. Some thin moves allow you to gain the corner. Climb the varied corner with one low angle wall and one steep.

Sorry for the high anchor, went to the natural end point ya know. knot your ends, you can down climb a bit or do some rope shenanagans if you dont have 2 ropes.

Named after the many midnight naked laps around creek pasture, camp good times!!!
content.location: Left side of public service. 7 minutes hike left from the top of the trail. The closest route is a unknown splitter tiny finger crack. Huge dihedral with a large pillar in front of it.

content.description: Begin by climbing a flake leaning up against the wall. Climb the .75 camalot splitter to sustained thin hands to a pod. Pull out of the pod and traverse left to the finger crack corner.
content.protection:
(2).3 camalots, (2).4 camalots, (2).5 camalots, (5).75 camalots, (3)#1 camalots (#2 friends work better)

(#5 camalot optional for pod)
content.location: Right side of public service wall

content.description: super long route
content.location: just left of Rubbin' the Nub

climbs.name: The Long Way Home
climbs.fa: Chris Kalous, Rebecca Bailey, Jim Nigro

content.description: Twin cracks lead to a rampy corner, some wide climbing to a splitter that dwindles to tight hands at the anchor. A cool voyage. Pretty close to 200'!
content.protection: A little bit of everything from big fingers to OW. Save some 2" for the end. Big rack.
content.location: This route starts around the corner from the prow that faces the road (Third World Lover). Probably the first route on what is considered the Public Service Wall. The anchors are hard to see. There is a plaque along the trail but the route starts on a ledge above. This route has been there for a while, we put it up with Third World Lover, but it got missed for the book. Probably not seen a 2nd ascent.

content.description: left facing corner hands all the way with great rest
content.location: 100 yards left from Repo man

content.description: This short warmup climb starts with a loose band with a chimney to the right before heading to a short splitter right facing corner. The climb ends on a pedastool with a bolted anchor.
content.protection: #2-4 camalots, a .5 will protect the starting boulder problem
content.location: Far right on the public service wall, consult a book. There is a plaque at the base of this climb.

content.description: A cruxy off width move at the start, to a fun chimney that is protected by fingers.
content.protection: #4 Camalot, .5 Camalots (3), .75 Camalots (2), #1 Camalot and Yellow C3.
content.location: It is on the Public Service Wall to the left of Trash Man and to the right of Sweet and Sour.

content.description: hands
content.location: way left all the way left look for a huge plaque at the base

content.description: Mostly hands and big hands with some crack switches.  A good warm up.
content.location: On the right side of the wall about 150m-200m past Not to Spicy.

content.description:
Super fun movement that rewards technique over brute.

A finger crack in a blocky right facing corner.

Stem up to a thin section mid way and continue with the stemming.

Bust left briefly towards the top and back right to the anchors. but be careful of the blocks there out left.
content.location: This is the right facing corner with the finger crack in it that sits to the left of 1 to 4.

climbs.name: Go Drown in a Lake of Diet Coke, Fucker!

content.description: A classic line with fun, varied climbing the whole way. Start in a tight flare that is thin hands and fingers until you're on top of the block. Then climb twin cracks with fun foot ledges up to a roof. Great move to pull the #2 roof and keep going to another stance below the squeeze. Start squeezing and keep it up for about 3 body lengths to the #1s roof. Plug gear and turn the lip. Keep going to the chains. a 70m rope just makes it back to the ground.
content.protection: Thin hands gear mostly. Some squeeze up higher but still thin heands in the back and at the lip of the roof. #1s down to .75 camalot at the very end. Some #2s for the middle roof and some fingers at the start. Maybe one bigger cam for the wide section (not the squeeze part). 70m rope
content.location: Right of Repo Man in the corner just right of the route with the bolts. About 30 feet up there is a block on the right with an X.

content.description: This route is bad to the bone! The first 2/3 is relatively mellow, going from hands down to tips with a stance. That's when things get rowdy. Micro cams at the roof protect the transition into the less-than-tips upper corner. Very insecure climbing protected by the tiniest of cams leads through this to the anchor. The crack waivers in size, making the gear placements fidgety. Good luck!
content.protection: A double set of thin hands to tips, then an army of tiny cams. I used multiple (4 or 5) grey and purple TCUs and c3s in the upper corner. The undulating crack makes other cams like black Aliens less ideal. I had a 70m rope, but I can't remember how much rope we had left over. A 60m may make it, but tie a knot just in case.

content.description: Follow a LF dihedral with some poor rock to a lieback roof with good gear.  Paste and lieback (isolated crux) around the roof to the right and follow a fun big hands crack to a fist section before the anchor.
content.protection: Doubles from .5 to 3, one 4 and maybe an extra 2
content.location: Just right of the popular Hands Ups...

content.description:
Yo Johnny Kovak!

We thought this was pretty good, but then everyone thinks his child is beautiful.

Starts with about 30' of "normal climbing", liebacking a shallow RF corner, then plugging some good hands before it widens.  A section of cups is followed by fists and wider to the anchors.  The occasional foothold makes the climbing relatively enjoyable for those with less than gorilla size mitts.
content.location: This climb is in the no man's land between Fin and Public Service Wall.  From Third World Lover, walk left/north for three to four minutes.  The climb is about 50' south of the first trees encountered since TWL and starts with a nice 12' RF corner that ends at a pod.  (Note that the trees mark the start of an undocumented multipitch 10+ called The Long Way Home.)  There is an undocumented line 5' right of F.I.S.T. (~60', 5.9, 1*)

content.description: thin hands start small roof hard size of ring locks splitter arches left to a OW ramp that get's you to the anchors
content.location: left of repo man 100yds

content.description: Varied climbing with an optional head scum/jam/bar to get through a little rooflette. Start straight in the flare up a little wideness to the aforementioned roof. Nice and varied!
content.location: Just a bit left of Blockhead, I'm a bit hazy on how far left since we put this up in 2013.

content.description: hands to wide, good for the aspiring OW climber
content.location: in-between "Fuck! If you can" and "Light Duty"

content.description: short and wide!
content.location: about 20 yards right of light duty

content.description: hands to fist roof
content.protection: couple #3s #4s and some hand sized pieces
content.location: just left of Repo Man

content.description:
A lovely route! Loose rock in spots, but it has mostly great rock, wonderfully fun movement, and is long!

Start in a corner with fingers in the corner and ringlocks on the straight in crack. Work up the corner to a stance on a block. Stem or layback up the slot to corner, and continue up the corner. It's nice to put a cam in the horizontal to keep the rope out of the crack.
content.protection: (1) #1, (5) 0.75, (3) red Metolius, (4) #0.5, (4) orange Metolius, (2) 0.4, (2) yellow Metolius, (2) 0.3
content.location: Located ~30' right of Pinché Puta and ~100' left of Hands Up.

content.description: A fun and varied climb. Locate obvious block feature wedged into crack/dihedral about 80-100' above the trail. Fun fingers and hands will get you to the top of the block. From there it's another 50 or so feet up a Slot Machine-esque feature with a 3-4" crack in the back to a stance to clip the anchors from.
content.protection: Can't remember exactly, but maybe a triple rack from .4 to #2 and 2 #3s and #4s. You might be able to get a #5 in up top too but I can't recall and I didn't have one but I did have an old #4 that I walked up the entire upper part.

content.description: Splitter crack that starts as thin hands, and  gradually widens to wide hands to a pod finish. Cold Shut Anchor.
content.location:
Obvious splitter

Route #7 in the Bloom Guide
